subject: RE: [junit] Re: Help! Stack trace truncated
msgSnippet: ... It s not Ant.  JB s right, it s the JVM. See http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.1/docs/api/java/lang/Throwable.html Particularly:
messageBody:
> From: Steve Kelem [mailto:steve@...]
>
> After looking through the JUnit source code, I'm pretty sure it's not
> JUnit. It may, however, be Ant's xml writer, but the same truncation
> happens whether I use Ant's xml writer or the plain writer. I can't
> find a setting for Ant that describes truncating output. JUnit's
> limit is called maxmessage, but I have it set to -1 so that it won't
> truncate.

It's not Ant. JB's right, it's the JVM.

See http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.1/docs/api/java/lang/Throwable.html

Particularly:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.1/docs/api/java/lang/Throwable.html#printStackT
race()

And:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.1/docs/api/java/lang/Throwable.html#getStackTra
ce()

Scott Stirling
